did.unittitle: Raymond Love films of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge construction

physdesc.extent: 3 reels stored in 1 half manuscript box

did.abstract: Raymond Love was always interested in photography and in 1953, after the birth of his daughter, he began to record movies on 8mm of his family. Raymond worked on the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, building the roadways near the end of the construction project. This collections consists of three 8mm reels depicting the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collections consists of three 8mm reels depicting the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. The reels were shot by Raymond Love, a construction worker on the bridge.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Raymond J. Love was born July 10, 1919 in Manhattan. He was one of eleven children of Sarah and John Love. He married Catherine Stanton in 1951 and they had five children (Kathryn, Patrick, Joan, John, and Nora). He worked for the Pennsylvania Railroad for 20 years, from 1949 to 1969, on the midnight to 8a.m. shift at Sunnyside Yards in Queens. During this period he also worked construction throughout the NYC metro area. One project Raymond Love worked on was the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, building the roadways near the end of the construction project. He retired in 1985 and passed away at the age of 84 on November 6, 2003.

Raymond Love was always interested in photography and in 1953, after the birth of his daughter, he began to record movies on 8mm film of his family. Each film he recorded was 8 minutes long; he spliced them together to make a longer film of each project.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Love Children (Kathi, Patrick, Joan, John, and Nora) in honor of their father, Raymond J. Love. Donation facilitated by Patrick Love.
